ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Chains Fixed?
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually since chains is a SNARE (level 1 root series spell) odds are that Verant finally fixed it so that snare doesn t override root/ensnare/whatever Which
ygData.messageBody:
Actually since chains is a SNARE (level 1 root series spell) odds are that
Verant finally fixed it so that snare doesn't override root/ensnare/whatever

Which is annoying to say the least but at least it makes some convoluted
sense. If chains isn't breaking early anymore I'll be happy with that.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Blitz Krieg" <blitz_krieg@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, June 25, 2000 1:20 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Chains Fixed?


> I've been noticing some strange things with chains recently. It doesn't
seem to be breaking early anymore (except rarely). In fact, I don't get the
break message until it would normally expire, even when root is cast after
chains. Also, when I rechain after root is cast, chains does not seem to
break root anymore, either.
>
> It's hard for me to test this out further as the root I'm working with is
a Mage pet's root, but here's what I'm noticing:
>
> When mob is fleeing (experienced this in Karnors), pet roots and the mob
turns around to attack. Obviously, we can't have this :p so I chain. Mob
stays facing the party like it's still rooted. It doesn't even turn around
for a second (like if the pet had rooted immediately after I chained) and I
haven't seen a 2nd root message.
>
> Anyone else noticing any of this? And, anyone else with access to a more
standard root willing to test?
>
> If root and chains are in fact stacking, I'm not sure if this is a plus or
not. I am always grouped with a mage, so the pet used to kill chains ALOT.
It's kinda nice to keep the slowdown effect while it's rooted, but I'd like
to see the mob stand there patiently trying to run away, too. :)
>
> Darkfox Reven'tsol
> Xegony
> Closing on 50!
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
